page.title: 02Education - Secondary
page.content: {MILNES HIGH SCHOOL}was founded in{1845 {Alexander Milne}a local boy who worked at Gordon Castle left on being ordered to cut his hair.He emigrated to {New {Orleans}in America where he died leaving $100 000 to build a school in Fochabers. The school was called {Milnes Free School}later to be known as{Milnes Institution. In{1982}the first phase of a five phase programme to build a modern school was completed.Due to the economic pressures on public spending the construction has extended over a number of years.It is hoped to complete the whole project by 1988. Milnes serves the surrounding areas pupils being bussed from{Lhanbryde, {Garmouth,Orton,Spey Bay}and{Braes of {Enzie. } The school day runs from 08:50 until 15:50.
